item.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that Congress and the President should increase basic pay for members of the Armed Forces.

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6963)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6963)

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that Congress and the President should: (1) increase basic pay for members of all military components by 3.5%, effective January 1, 2008; and (2) provide a special survivor indemnity allowance for persons affected by required Survivor Benefit Plan (SBP) annuity offsets for dependency and indemnity compensation.

bill.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of Congress that Congress and the President should increase basic pay for members of the Armed Forces.

item.title: A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of Congress that Congress and the President should increase basic pay for members of the Armed Forces.
A concurrent resolution expressing the sense of Congress that Congress and the President should increase basic pay for members of the Armed Forces.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6963)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
